Instead what happens is people go into these discussions thinking that they're going to be best friends for life in some cases, and they think that what's going to happen is that they're going to see people as people and they're going to move beyond race.

But instead what happens is they hear stories about discrimination, and they hear stories that illuminate the very different perspectives that people of different racial backgrounds have in this country and they're surprised.

They would never know that these differences in perspectives and histories and experiences exist.
